title: Basic For Loop with Range
description: Print numbers 0 through 4 using a for loop.
hints: Use range(5) to generate numbers 0-4
Use a for loop to iterate and print each number

title: Range with Start and Stop
description: Print numbers 3 through 7 using range().
hints: Use range(start, stop) with two arguments
range(3, 8) gives 3 through 7 (stop is exclusive)

title: Range with Step
description: Print even numbers 0 through 8 using range().
hints: Use range(start, stop, step) with three arguments
range(0, 9, 2) counts by 2s

title: Loop in Reverse
description: Print numbers 5 down to 1 using range().
hints: Use negative step: range(5, 0, -1)
Stop is exclusive, so use 0 to include 1

title: Loop Through List
description: Print each fruit in the list.
hints: Use for fruit in fruits:
Print each fruit in the loop body

title: Loop Through String
description: Print each character in 'hello' on a separate line.
hints: Strings are iterable just like lists
Use for char in word:

title: Loop with Index - Enumerate
description: Print the index and value for each color using enumerate().
hints: Use enumerate(colors) to get both index and value
Unpack with: for i, color in enumerate(colors):

title: Enumerate with Custom Start
description: Print 1-indexed positions (starting from 1) using enumerate().
hints: Use enumerate(items, start=1)
The start parameter changes the initial index

title: Loop Two Lists - Zip
description: Print pairs from both lists using zip().
hints: Use zip(names, ages) to pair up elements
Unpack with: for name, age in zip(names, ages):

title: Loop Dictionary Keys
description: Print each key from the dictionary.
hints: Loop directly over the dictionary: for key in person:
Or explicitly use: for key in person.keys():

title: Loop Dictionary Values
description: Print each value from the dictionary.
hints: Use scores.values() to get just the values
for score in scores.values():

title: Loop Dictionary Items
description: Print key-value pairs using items().
hints: Use data.items() to get both keys and values
Unpack with: for key, value in data.items():

description: Print each unique number from the set (duplicates removed).
hints: Sets automatically remove duplicates
Use: for num in numbers:

title: Loop Through Tuple
description: Print each coordinate from the tuple.
hints: Tuples are iterable just like lists
Use: for coord in point:

title: Nested Loop - 2D List
description: Print all numbers from the 2D list (matrix) using nested loops.
hints: Use nested for loops
Outer loop iterates rows, inner loop iterates elements in each row

title: Basic While Loop
description: Print numbers 1 through 5 using a while loop.
hints: Use while i <= 5:
Don't forget to increment i inside the loop

title: While Loop with Break
description: Print numbers starting from 0, but stop the loop when i equals 3.
hints: Use break to exit the loop early
Check if i == 3 before printing, then break

title: Skip with Continue
description: Print numbers 0-5, but skip number 3 using continue.
hints: continue skips to the next iteration
Check if i == 3, then continue before printing

title: Exit Loop with Break
description: Loop through fruits and stop when you find 'cherry'.
hints: Print each fruit before checking
Use break when fruit == 'cherry'

title: For-Else Clause
description: Print numbers 0-2, then print 'Complete' after the loop finishes normally.
hints: The else clause runs if the loop completes without hitting break
Add else: after the for loop (same indentation as for)

title: For-Else with Break
description: Loop 0-4, but break when i equals 2. Notice the else block won't run.
hints: Print i, then check if i == 2 and break
Add else: print('Complete') to see it's skipped when break executes

title: Loop List by Index
description: Access list elements by index using range().
hints: Use range(len(items)) to get indices
Access elements with items[i]

title: Loop in Reverse - Reversed
description: Print the list in reverse order using reversed().
hints: Use reversed(nums) to get a reverse iterator
for num in reversed(nums):

title: Loop in Sorted Order
description: Print numbers in ascending order using sorted().
hints: Use sorted(nums) to return a new sorted list
for num in sorted(nums):

title: Loop with Inline Condition
description: Print only the even numbers from the list.
hints: Check if num % 2 == 0 inside the loop
Print only when the condition is true

title: Accumulator Pattern - Sum
description: Calculate the sum of all numbers using a loop and print the result.
hints: Loop through numbers and add each to total
total += num inside the loop

title: Accumulator Pattern - List
description: Build a list of squares [1, 4, 9, 16, 25] using a loop.
hints: Loop through range(1, 6)
Use squares.append(i ** 2) inside the loop

title: Zip Three Lists
description: Loop through three lists simultaneously using zip().
hints: Use zip(names, ages, cities)
Unpack with: for name, age, city in zip(...):

Print count, increment it, then break when count == 3
